page.title: 13The Manifold Valley Track
page.content:
Many tourists come to walk on the Manifold Valley Track which runs from Hulme End to Waterhouses, a distance of about 8 miles. It was first built for the Leek and Manifold Light Railway which opened in 1904 and closed because of lack of money in 1934. It was a 30 inch narrow gauge line and carried mainly milk and tourists.
In 1984, to commemorate 80 years of the railway being opened and 50 years of it being closed, they had a miniature train put on the track at Hulme End one weekend and it took passengers about a quarter of a mile down the track and back. It did very well so they repeated the idea this year with a longer track and for two weekends.
